qas.question: What is the official dress code today at Buckingham Palace?

answers.text: there is no official dress code

qas.question: Which Queen tried and failed to raise the hemline of her dress after WWI?
Which King was horrified to see the Queen's hemline raised a few inches?
The hemline of daytime skirts were allowed to rise after which year?
The knee breeches men formerly wore to the palace were of what era's design?
From what century were men's knee breeches worn at Buckingham designed in?
What were women obliged to wear in their hair?
Which queen wanted to shorten her skirt's hemline?
Which King was horrified to see the raised hemline on the Queen?
What is the dress code today at Buckingham?

answers.text: there is no official dress code

qas.question: What were women required to wear in their socks?
Which Queen raised the hemline of her dress after WWI?
Which King was amused to see the Queen's hemline raised a few inches?
What century were men's knee breeches forbidden at Buckingham?
Which queen wanted to extend her skirt's hemline?

context: Formerly, men not wearing military uniform wore knee breeches of an <a4_0><a5_0><b13_0>18th-century<b13_0/> design<a5_0/><a4_0/>. Women's evening dress included obligatory trains and <a6_0><b10_0>tiaras or feathers<b10_0/><a6_0/> in their hair (or both). The dress code governing formal court uniform and dress has progressively relaxed. After World War I, when <a1_0><a7_0><b11_0><b14_0>Queen Mary<b14_0/><b11_0/><a7_0/><a1_0/> wished to follow fashion by raising her skirts a few inches from the ground, she requested a lady-in-waiting to shorten her own skirt first to gauge the king's reaction. <a2_0><b12_0>King <a8_0>George V<b12_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/> was horrified, so the queen kept her hemline unfashionably low. Following their accession in <a3_0>1936<a3_0/>, King George VI and his consort, Queen Elizabeth, allowed the hemline of daytime skirts to rise. Today, <a0_0><a9_0>there is no official dress code<a9_0/><a0_0/>. Most men invited to Buckingham Palace in the daytime choose to wear service uniform or lounge suits; a minority wear morning coats, and in the evening, depending on the formality of the occasion, black tie or white tie.
